- whines about both parties are far right- whines about pr being hypocrites supporting MahathirWell the world doesn't run on idealism. the reality is that the country is run on 2 party democratic systemTS should start his own party then. Sometimes I don't know what these people want. In politics it's always the lesser evil. Idealism doesn't work in the real world. People need to realize it's the same in the entire world. There is no "choice", it's human nature. Our voices do not matter in the long run, in any society the "alpha" or "global elite bankers" or "cronies" or "dictators" will always be at the top. Thousands of years of human civilisation has been the same. To ignore history is to be ignorant. We just have to accept gradual change.If TS and other whining bitches don't even dare to make a change in the ruling party establishment for a 5 year term, then they are the biggest hypocrites talking about idealism.

I guess that's why the fence sitter is a fence sitter.They have unrealistic thinking that there will be a perfect party made of perfect people that will make perfect decision for them, and everything can be changed in an instant. So forever they wait.Newsflash, real world doesn't work that way. Changes in a party will be gradual, but it won't start if the governing party doesn't change.

yes, choices everywhere but how about ideal choices?voting independent candidate and party wont make a huge difference.the best bet against BN is via PH. for all i know, they are all bogus politician but i would like a fresh government and see what they can do in their reigning terms then only decide who to vote in next GE.

The only thing that will force CLEAN leaders is accountability and the only way we will have accountability is by government change. How do you expect any sort of clean government when the institutions of the country are completely dominated and controller by one party? If BN was in opposition instead of government you would see every single scandal be revealed like in Penang/Selangor.

There's always a 3rd party choice.The reason why it ends up a two party system is because people support a 2 party system.Just like how some people here attack the 3rd party as splitting votes.When that's essentially what democracy is.It's kind of funny, since BN never had issues with more than two party competing.

First of all, who's going to punish mahathir?Logically the one in opposition of mahathir should be one that punish him. That's bijan, and his BN is the one that's currently holding power in Malaysia. So why he and his BN still not punishing him?

To change the current governing party,  you need to put alot of hardwork to entice and convince that the alternative is way better than the current. We have seen lot of hanky panky even before the alternative is holding the federal gov, so what make you think they want a change. A change starts from us albeit a small one.  Picking clean leaders is a good start.If you think they will change once holding the power,  than be my guess.  Power currupts people,  only the clean can master.
